result.execSummary:
The defendant Cameron R Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cameron R Adams is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cameron R Adams was found guilty of Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A", Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
TIME SERVED disposition.

This CASE is consecutive with 15CF1368.

Court waived all applicable costs, fees and surcharges due to restitution amount to be determined on 15CF1368. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge NOT IMPOSED, due to imposition of DNA surcharge on 15CF1368

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cameron R Adams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing NOVEMBER 10, 2015 received and filed. (30 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to INSTITUTION

Defendant Cameron R Adams in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Cameron R Adams in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  PSI reviewed and corrections made.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

Court ordered defendant to serve 230 days in the House of Correction, with 230 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  This is case is consecutive with 15CF1368.

Court ordered waived applicable costs, fees and surcharges due to the restitution amount to be determined on 15CF1368.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge NOT IMPOSED. due to imposition of DNA surcharge on 15CF1368
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.

Defendant Cameron R Adams in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Cameron R Adams in custody.  Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered addition of Count 2, Operating Vehicle without Owner's Consent,  contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 943.23(4m), 939.51(3)(a), 939.05 , a Class A misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Cameron R Adams not in court, in custody.  Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  On parties request Court grants one more adjounment.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch  19.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Cameron R Adams not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Cameron Russel Adams not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests  more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Cameron R Adams not in court, in custody.  Irene Parthum for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cameron R Adams in court with James Bowers, student intern under the supervision of Vince Guimont for attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Cameron R Adams in custody.  Ron Dague for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No driving without a valid license or Insurance.

Defendant Cameron R Adams in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Cameron R Adams in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
